intro: Chaeturus divaricatus, commonly known as the variable chaetocarp, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its branched stems and opposite leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. It produces small, clustered flowers with four petals, typically in shades of white or pale yellow. The fruit is a small capsule that contains several seeds, which are dispersed by wind.
